publications.title: Generation of two induced pluripotent stem cell lines from a patient with Stargardt Macular Dystrophy caused by the c.768G > T and c.6079C > T mutations in ABCA4

donor.disease_description: Autosomal recessive Stargardt disease (STGD1) caused by compound heterozygous ABCA4 mutations c.768G>T and c.6079C>T

genomic_modifications.description: Compound heterozygous ABCA4 mutations c.768G>T and c.6079C>T (patient-derived, hereditary)

genomic_characterisation.summary: Normal male diploid karyotype (46,XY) with no chromosomal abnormalities detected by SNP array and CNV analysis; CNV analysis resolution ~500 kbp.

induced_derivation.non_int_vector_name: Episomal plasmids containing OCT4, SOX2, KLF4, L-MYC, LIN28, shRNA for p53 and miR-302/367

ethics.institutional_HREC: Sir Charles Gairdner Hospital Human Research Ethics Committee
University of Western Australia Human Research Ethics Committee
